intro: Euonymus europaeus var. atropurpureus, commonly known as the purple euonymus, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe. It is characterized by its dark purple to reddish stems and leaves that turn vibrant red or orange in the fall. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring, followed by orange-red蒴果 (capsules) that split open to release seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Its compact growth habit and seasonal color changes make it a valuable addition to landscaped areas.
